programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: BBC One joins the BBC's rolling news channel for a night of news.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: The latest news, sport, business and weather from the BBC's Breakfast team.

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Gary Lineker introduces highlights of today's Premier League games, including Liverpool's clash with Brentford. It's been a topsy-turvy season for Jürgen Klopp's Reds, and they now face a tough test against Thomas Frank's Brentford side, who continue to punch above their weight and boast the prolific Ivan Toney in their ranks. Manchester City continue their attempt to win the Premier League for the third year running against relegation-battling Leeds, who lost 7-0 on their last visit to the Etihad Stadium and have conceded a total of 14 goals in their last three matches against Pep Guardiola's side. Elsewhere, Bournemouth will be searching for three points in their battle to secure Premier League survival as they take on Chelsea, Tottenham have a London derby at home against Crystal Palace, and Wolves welcome Aston Villa to Molineux.

programme.title: Sunday with Laura Kuenssberg
programme.desc: Interviews with key politicians and public figures.

programme.title: Politics England
programme.desc: The latest political news, interviews and debate.

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt hosts a special edition of the BBC's live cookery show to mark the historical event of the coronation of King Charles III. He is joined by chefs Adam Byatt and Anna Haugh, who will rustle up some royal recipes. Guests Jennie Bond and Gyles Brandreth will join our party to share memories of Charles and the wider royal family, and our resident expert Helen McGinn will have an array of drinks, perfect for any celebration.

programme.title: Songs of Praise (A Coronation Celebration) (n°6)
programme.desc: «A Coronation Celebration»Katherine Jenkins celebrates the coronation of King Charles III at Hampton Court Palace.

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman presents highlights of today's Premier League fixtures, including Arsenal's crucial match against Newcastle as the Gunners' bid for the title continues. Arsenal's visit to St James' Park is arguably their hardest remaining fixture of the season. The Geordies frustrated the Gunners back in January as the reverse fixtured ended 0-0, and Mikel Arteta knows how tough a task his side have if they are to claim three crucial points towards their title challenge. The day's other game sees West Ham entertain Champions League-chasing Manchester United at the London Stadium.

programme.title: The Women's Football Show
programme.desc: Highlights from the Women's Super League.
